page.title: 18Belstead House
page.content: Belstead House is situated on the edge of the area and overlooks the new road linking the Southern by-pass with the new Orwell Bridge. It once stood in its own grounds, but is now flanked on two sides by modern housing. The sale of the land provided funds to build a dining extension to the House. Dating back to probably the seventeenth century, the House was in use for many years as the residence of visiting circuit judges. It is now an adult education centre run by Suffolk County Council and it offers residential courses to the general public and in particular to teachers.Typical courses this year include: Micro electronics writing workshop, Middle management in secondary schools, Practical story telling, Primary mathematics 5-9,The Suffolk Curriculum - implementation.
